item.title: Erika add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "Contradictions do not exist. Whenever you think that you are facing a contradiction, check your premises. You will find that one of them is wrong." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Erika add a quote by Karl Wallenda
item.description: "Being on the tightrope is living; everything else is waiting." -- Karl Wallenda

item.title: Erika add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Erika add a quote by Thomas Edison
item.description: "When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this - you haven't." -- Thomas Edison

item.title: Erika add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "There are no rules here -- we're trying to accomplish something." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Erika add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description:
"Study, along the lines which the theologies have mapped, will never lead us to discovery of the fundamental facts of our existence</b>. That goal must be attained by means of exact science and can only be achieved by such means. The fact that man, for ages, has superstitiously believed in what he calls a God does not prove at all that his theory has been right. There have been many gods – all makeshifts, born of inability to fathom the deep fundamental truth. There must be something at the bottom of existence, and man, in ignorance, being unable to discover what it is through reason, because his reason has been so imperfect, undeveloped, has used, instead, imagination, and created figments, of one kind or another, which, according to the country he was born in, the suggestions of his environment, satisfied him for the time being. Not one of all the gods of all the various theologies has ever really been proved. We accept no ordinary scientific fact without the final proof; why should we, then, be satisfied in this most mighty of all matters, with a mere theory?
Destruction of false theories will not decrease the sum of human happiness in future, any more than it has in the past... The days of miracles have passed. I do not believe, of course, that there was ever any day of actual miracles. I cannot understand that there were ever any miracles at all. My guide must be my reason, and at thought of miracles my reason is rebellious. Personally, I do not believe that Christ laid claim to doing miracles, or asserted that he had miraculous power...
Our intelligence is the aggregate intelligence of the cells which make us up. There is no soul, distinct from mind, and what we speak of as the mind is just the aggregate intelligence of cells. It is fallacious to declare that we have souls apart from animal intelligence, apart from brains. It is the brain that keeps us going. There is nothing beyond that.
Life goes on endlessly, but no more in human beings than in other animals, or, for that matter, than in vegetables. Life, collectively, must be immortal, human beings, individually, cannot be, as I see it, for they are not the individuals – they are mere aggregates of cells.
There is no supernatural. We are continually learning new things. There are powers within us which have not yet been developed and they will develop. We shall learn things of ourselves, which will be full of wonders, but none of them will be beyond the natural.
[<i>Columbian Magazine interview</i>]" -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Erika add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Whoever wants music instead of noise, joy instead of pleasure, soul instead of gold, creative work instead of business, passion instead of foolery, finds no home in this trivial world of ours." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Erika add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "To hold our tongues when everyone is gossiping, to smile without hostility at people and institutions, to compensate for the shortage of love in the world with more love in small, private matters; to be more faithful in our work, to show greater patience, to forgo the cheap revenge obtainable from mockery and criticism: all these are things we can do. " -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Erika add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Erika add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "We are not going in circles, we are going upwards. The path is a spiral; we have already climbed many steps." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Erika add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Oh, love isn't there to make us happy. I believe it exists to show us how much we can endure." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Erika add a quote by Allie Brosh
item.description: "The absurdity of working so hard to continue doing something you don’t like can be overwhelming." -- Allie Brosh

item.title: Erika add a quote by Allie Brosh
item.description: "Тo me, the future doesn’t seem real. It’s just this magical place where I can put my responsibilities so that I don’t have to be scared while hurtling toward failure at eight hundred miles per hour." -- Allie Brosh

item.title: Erika add a quote by Matsuo Basho
item.description: "The journey itself is my home." -- Matsuo Basho

item.title: Erika add a quote by Basho
item.description: "Real poetry, is to lead a beautiful life. To live poetry is better than to write it." -- Basho

item.title: Erika add a quote by Basho
item.description: "Sitting quietly, doing nothing, Spring comes, and the grass grows, by itself." -- Basho
